name: Exeggcute

attacks.name: Growth Spurt
attacks.effect: Take a [G] Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

description:
Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs,
it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates
with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking
different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be
very interested in one another.

attacks.name: Powerful Bloom
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

name: Snivy
description:
Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements
swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

name: Servine
description:
It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift
movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks
with a vine whip.

name: Serperior
description:
It only gives its all against strong opponents who
are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s
noble eyes.

name: Morelull
description:
Pokémon living in the forest eat the
delicious caps on Morelull’s head.
The caps regrow overnight.

name: Shiinotic

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to
sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing,
it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

name: Dhelmise

attacks.name: Energy Whip
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra [G] Energy attached, this attack does 70 more damage.

description:
After a piece of seaweed merged with debris
from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this
ghost Pokémon.

name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

description:
It can’t run properly when it’s newly born.
As it races around with others of its kind,
its legs grow stronger.

name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
This Pokémon can be seen galloping through
fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane
fluttering in the wind.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.effect: Discard 2 [R] Energy from this Pokémon.

description:
Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it
regrets this habit once it realizes that it has
burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

name: Larvesta
description:
This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole
the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns
can cut right through a sheet of iron.

name: Volcarona

attacks.name: Volcanic Ash
attacks.effect: Discard 2 [R] Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot
parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is
revered as an embodiment of the sun.

name: Salandit

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

description:
It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow,
rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic
gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

name: Salazzle

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with
poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring
movements to turn them into loyal servants.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Leap Out
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

description:
An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may
jump high on rare occasions but never more
than seven feet.

attacks.name: Rampaging Whirlpool
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from among the Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Vaporeon
description:
It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with
a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.

name: Finneon
description:
The line running down its side can store sunlight.
It shines vividly at night.

name: Lumineon

attacks.name: Aqua Liner
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
With its shining light, it lures its prey close.
However, the light also happens to attract
ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.

name: Chewtle
description:
Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the
tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another
Chewtle’s horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.

name: Drednaw

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a
boulder in a single bite. This Pokémon
has an extremely vicious disposition.

name: Cramorant

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

description:
It’s so strong that it can knock out some
opponents in a single hit, but it also may
forget what it’s battling midfight.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage for each of your Benched [L] Pokémon.

description:
When it is angered, it immediately discharges the
energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
Its tail discharges electricity into the ground,
protecting it from getting shocked.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

description:
Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon
around as a defense against Electabuzz that
come seeking electricity.

name: Joltik
description:
Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon.
It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t
produce a charge on its own.

name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

description:
It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its
means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could
be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

description:
It’s small and its electricity-generating organ is
not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb
electricity from people’s homes and charge itself.

name: Mew

attacks.name: sy Report
attacks.effect: Your opponent reveals their hand.

description:
Because it can use all kinds of moves, many
scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor
of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

name: Sigilyph

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

description:
Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some
say they were the guardians of an ancient city.
Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.

name: Elgyem
description:
If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery
will appear on the screen. That scenery is said
to be from its home.

name: Beheeyem

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

description:
Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm,
a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

description:
This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden
within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly
fond of red flowers.

name: Floette

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon draws forth what power is left in
withered flowers to make them healthy again.
It holds a red flower.

name: Florges

attacks.name: Bloomshine
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

description:
This Pokémon creates an impressive flower
garden in its territory. It draws forth the power
of the red flowers around its neck.

name: Swirlix
description:
It eats its own weight in sugar every day.
If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes
incredibly grumpy.

name: Slurpuff
description:
By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their
mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that
this skill will have many medical applications.

name: Mankey

attacks.name: ocus ist
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

description:
It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of
its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

name: Primeape
description:
It becomes wildly furious if it even senses
someone looking at it. It chases anyone
that meets its glare.

name: Geodude
description:
Geodude that have lived a long life have had all
their edges smoothed out until they’re totally
round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

name: Graveler
description:
It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak
of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit,
it rolls back down the way it came.

name: Golem

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks.

description:
When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their
shells. Those that have lived a long, long time
have shells green with moss.

name: Marshadow

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.effect: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
It slips into the shadows of others and mimics
their powers and movements. As it improves, it
becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.

name: Stonjourner
description:
The elemental composition of the rocks that
form its body were found to match the bedrock
of a land far away from this Pokémon’s habitat.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: ivision
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Koffing from your deck onto your Bench.

description:
Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into
garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw,
rotting trash.

name: Weezing

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

description:
If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one
deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

name: Purrloin
description:
It steals things from people just to amuse itself
with their frustration. A rivalry exists between
this Pokémon and Nickit.

name: Liepard
description:
Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant
figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

name: Venipede
description:
Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species,
but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.

name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

description:
This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into
its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.

name: Scolipede

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

description:
Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on
its neck before slamming them into the ground
and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.

name: Druddigon
description:
Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips
sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body
gets too cold.

name: Pidgey
description:
A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps
its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Pidgeotto
description:
The claws on its feet are well developed.
It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute
to its nest over 60 miles away.

attacks.name: Scattering Cyclone
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Tauros

attacks.name: Fighting Tackle
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon  more damage.

description:
When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails,
it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to
charge with astounding speed.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: ontinuous Steps
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

description:
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to
adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

name: Chatot

attacks.name: Mimic
attacks.effect: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.

description:
It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them
into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t
attack it.

name: Old Amber
effect: Play this card as if it were a 40-HP Basic [C] Pokémon.At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.This card can't retreat.

name: Pokémon Flute
effect: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto their Bench.

name: Mythical Slab
effect: Look at the top card of your deck. If that card is a [P] Pokémon, put it into your hand. If it is not a [P] Pokémon, put it on the bottom of your deck.

name: Budding Expeditioner
effect: Put your Mew ex in the Active Spot into your hand.

name: Blue
effect: During your opponent's next turn, all of your Pokémon take −10 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Leaf
effect: During this turn, the Retreat Cost of your Active Pokémon is 2 less.

name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

description:
Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking
different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be
very interested in one another.

name: Serperior
description:
It only gives its all against strong opponents who
are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s
noble eyes.

name: Salandit

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

description:
It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow,
rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic
gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

name: Vaporeon
description:
It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with
a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.

name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

description:
It’s small and its electricity-generating organ is
not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb
electricity from people’s homes and charge itself.

name: Marshadow

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.effect: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

description:
It slips into the shadows of others and mimics
their powers and movements. As it improves, it
becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.

attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from among the Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

effect: During this turn, the Retreat Cost of your Active Pokémon is 2 less.

attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.
